availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah L. Browder (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer and pvt. 17th ky Cav USA)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Hopkins County, Kentucky, native. Married to Julia A. Browder. Father of Elizabeth Browder, L. Q. Browder, and Charles R. Browder. Laborer for Ira P. Granger in Vanderburgh County, Indiana, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 3, 1865. Died from remittent fever at Bowling Green on August 9, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Knight, p. 478B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 821.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0137.
